Name: Reporting the locations of vacant properties to each council member.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting the locations of vacant properties to each council member

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: April 25, 2018 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - April 25, 2018

Summary: This bill would require a city agency, at the Mayor’s designation, to submit biennial report to each Council Member that catalogues the number and location of vacant, abandoned properties in each Council District.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
	Section 1. Section 3-119.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision d to read as follows:
      d. On or before July 1, 2018 and on or before July 1 of every other year thereafter, the mayor or such designated agency shall submit a report to each council member describing the location of each vacant residential building and each vacant lot located within the district of such council member.
      � 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
